intro: Adinandra stylosa, commonly known as the African velvetwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by black, spherical berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and durable timber, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
